summary.long: Nahum is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The burden of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is jealous, and the LORD avenges; the LORD avenges and is furious; the LORD will take vengeance on his adversaries, and he reserves wrath for his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD is slow to anger and great in power and will not at all treat the guilty as though they were innocent; the LORD whose way is in the whirlwind and in the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He reprehends the sea and makes it dry and dries up all the rivers; Bashan was destroyed, and Carmel; and the flower of Lebanon was destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mountains quake at him, and the hills melt, and the earth is burned at his presence, and the world and all that dwell therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can stand before his indignation? and who can abide in the fierceness of his anger? his fury is poured out like fire, and the rocks are thrown down by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble; and he knows those that trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with an overrunning flood he will make an utter end of his place, and darkness shall pursue his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do ye imagine against the LORD? he will make an utter end; he will not hold back the tribulation the second time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For while they are entwined together as thorns, and while the drunkards shall be drinking, they shall be devoured as stubble full of dryness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has come out of thee that has imagined evil against the LORD, a counsellor of Belial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus hath the LORD said: For much rest that they have, and though they are many, yet thus shall they be cut down, and he shall pass through. Though I have afflicted thee, I will afflict thee no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now I will break his yoke from off thee and will burst thy bonds in sunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD shall give a commandment concerning thee that no one else of thy name ever be sown; out of the house of thy god I will cut off the graven image and the molten image; I will make it thy grave because thou wert vile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that brings good tidings, of him that publishes peace! O Judah, keep thy solemn feasts, perform thy vows; for Belial shall no longer pass through thee; he is utterly cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The destroyer is risen up against thee: keep the fortress, watch the way, make thy loins strong, fortify thy power mightily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the LORD shall restore the glory of Jacob as the glory of Israel; for the emptiers have emptied them out and marred their vine branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shield of his valiant ones shall be red, the men of his army are in scarlet, the chariot as fire of torches in the day which shall be made ready; the fir trees shall be terribly shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chariots shall rage in the streets; they shall flow through the streets, their faces like torches; they shall run like the lightnings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall remember his valiant ones; they shall stumble in their walk when they make haste to their wall, and the covering shall be prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gates of the rivers shall be opened, and the palace shall be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the queen shall be taken captive; they shall order her to go up, and her maids shall take her, mourning as with the voice of doves, beating upon their breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nineveh was of old like a pool of water; but now they flee away. Stand, stand, shall they cry; but no one looks back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the spoil of silver, take the spoil of gold, for there is no end of the riches; honour, more than all the desirable furniture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is empty and worn out and is in pieces, and the heart melted, the knees smite together, and much pain is in the kidneys, and the faces of them all gather blackness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What of the dwelling of the lions and of the feeding place of the young lions where the lion and the lioness walked and the lion’s whelps, and no one made them afraid?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lion tore in pieces enough for his whelps and strangled for his lionesses and filled his holes with prey and his dens with robbery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I speak unto thee, saith the LORD of the hosts, and I will burn and reduce thy chariots into smoke, and the sword shall devour thy young lions; and I will cut off thy robbery from the earth, and the voice of thy ambassadors shall never be heard again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to the bloody city! it is all full of lies and robbery; stealing does not depart from her!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The noise of the whip and the noise of the rattling of the wheels and of the prancing horses and of the jumping chariots shall be heard in thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The horseman lifts up both the bright sword and the glittering spear, and there is a multitude of slain and a great number of carcasses; and there shall be no end of their corpses; they stumble upon their corpses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the multitude of the whoredoms of the harlot of beautiful grace, the mistress of witchcrafts that sells the Gentiles into slavery through her whoredoms and peoples through her witchcrafts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here I am against thee, saith the LORD of the hosts, and I will uncover thy skirts upon thy face, and I will show the Gentiles thy nakedness and the kingdoms thy shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will cast abominable filth upon thee and make thee vile and will set thee as dung.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, that all those that look upon thee shall flee from thee and say, Nineveh is laid waste; who will bemoan her? from where shall I seek comforters for thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art thou better than populous No that was situated among the rivers, that had the waters round about it, whose rampart was the sea, and her wall was from the sea?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ethiopia was thy strength and Egypt with no limit; Put and Libia went to thy aid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet she was carried away, she went into captivity; her young children also were dashed in pieces at the top of all the streets: and they cast lots for her honourable men, and all her nobles were bound in chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou also shalt be drunken; thou shalt be encompassed; thou also shalt seek strength because of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All thy strongholds are like fig trees with the firstripe figs; if they are shaken, they even fall into the mouth of the eater.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, thy people in the midst of thee shall be like women; the gates of thy land shall be set wide open unto thine enemies; the fire shall devour thy bars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Draw thee waters for the siege, fortify thy strong holds: go into clay, and tread the mortar, make strong the brickkiln.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off; it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself many as the cankerworm, make thyself many as the locusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast multiplied thy merchants above the stars of heaven; the cankerworm spoils and flies away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy princes shall be as the locusts and thy captains as the great grasshoppers which camp in the hedges in the cold day, but when the sun arises, they flee away, and it is not known where they were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy shepherds have slumbered, O king of Assyria; thy valiant ones are at rest; thy people scattered themselves upon the mountains, and there is no one to unite them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no cure for thy destruction; thy wound is grievous; all that hear thy story shall clap their hands over thee; for upon whom has not thy wickedness passed continually?
verses.speaker: Narrator
